Key Match Events: Ross Adair wins the Player of the Match award for his century off 58 balls.
Paul Stirling wins the Player of the Series award.
Ireland beat South Africa for the first time in T20Is and leveled the series 1-1.
Pre-Game Insights: Ireland will hope that their bowling attack can really up their game.
South Africa has looked a much better side after the poor show in the UAE against Afghanistan earlier.
Post-Match Reflections: Paul Stirling, the winning captain, says the team felt they were 15-20 runs short but managed to pull through and secure the win.
Aiden Markram, the captain of South Africa, says there were small moments with both bat and ball which they missed on.
Ross Adair wins the Player of the Match award and says he wanted to put his mark and get a good score.
Paul Stirling wins the Player of the Series award.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Irish side will be under pressure to step up after their loss in the previous game.
South Africa's hopes rested on Breetzke, but his dismissal in the penultimate over left them in a precarious position.
Ireland's bowlers and fielders held their nerve in the closing stages, executing perfect death bowling and sharp fielding to stifle any late resurgence.
Others: The match ended in a draw with both teams sharing the trophy.
The series will continue with a 3-match ODI series starting on October 2, 2024.
